Plot: Babs Flynn (Jackson) is the manager of a Liverpool boutique. When she accuses the regional manager of sexual harassment she is sacked. She mounts a public campaign to get her job back. The film was met with positive reviews. It starred a young Craig Charles as Cathy Tysons love interest and they were a couple at the time. It was based on a real case at a chain of boutiques called Lady at Lord John.[1][2]
Awards: Business as Usual won the Grand Prix at the 1988 Créteil International Women's Film Festival.[3]
starring: Glenda Jackson John Thaw Cathy Tyson
